means: 使大为吃惊，使惊奇( amaze的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: You'll be amazed at the culinary creations possible in a Dutch oven.
sentence.Network_cn: 荷兰烤箱能够做的食物之多会让你感到惊奇。

sentence.Network_en: We were amazed, shocked, dumbfounded, shaking our heads in disbelief.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们震惊、愕然、目瞪口呆，难以置信地摇着头。

sentence.Network_en: I'm amazed they had the cheek to ask in the first place.
sentence.Network_cn: 我真惊讶他们当初竟然有脸问。

encyclopedia.content: amazed 英[ə'meizd]美[ə'meizd] a.大为惊奇 同反义词 参考例句 After Tothero’s build-up Rabbit is amazed that Margaret is just another Janice 经过托特洛一番渲染，“兔子”吃惊地发现，玛格丽特完全是另一位简妮丝。 They will tell you many things which you have never known and whereat you will be amazed 他们会告诉你许多你闻所未闻、使你拍案称奇的事情。I was amazed at my own intensity and

entry.def: If something amazes you, it surprises you very much.

example.ex: He amazed us by his knowledge of Welsh history...
example.tran: 他对威尔士的历史知之甚多，让我们惊讶。

example.ex: The Riverside Restaurant promises a variety of food that never ceases to amaze!
example.tran: 滨河饭店总能提供品种繁多、令人称奇的食物。

means.word_mean: 1. filled with the emotional impact of overwhelming surprise or shock;

sentences.sentence: "an amazed audience gave the magician a standing ovation"
"I stood enthralled, astonished by the vastness and majesty of the cathedral"
"astounded viewers wept at the pictures from the Oklahoma City bombing"
"stunned scientists found not one but at least three viruses"

auth_sentence.content: Because we have been amazed by the widespread and enduring quality of these rumors.

auth_sentence.content: Mr Cannan said he was "amazed" by the figure, which Mr Brown described as the cost "to date".

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mr Cannan said he was "amazed" by the figure, which Mr Brown described as the cost "to date".

auth_sentence.content: Mercedes estimates 0-62-mph acceleration in 5.6 seconds and I'd be amazed if the SLK wasn't a couple ticks quicker.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mercedes estimates 0-62-mph acceleration in 5.6 seconds and I'd be amazed if the SLK wasn't a couple ticks quicker.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mercedes estimates 0-62-mph acceleration in 5.6 seconds and I'd be amazed if the SLK wasn't a couple ticks quicker.

Sentence.sentence: The editor is amazed at how quickly Smith gets his stories—only minutes after they happen—but soon he's presented with a contract to sign.

His product launches, at which he would stand alone on a black stage and produce as if by magic an "incredible" new electronic gadget （小器具）in front of an amazed crowd, were the performances of a master showman.
